availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Employed Mattie Johnson as a house servant in 1863. Indicted with Mattie Johnson for aiding in the escape of an enslaved boy and girl to Jeffersonville, Indiana, in Louisville, Kentucky, in September 1863. Pardoned by Thomas E. Bramlette on March 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
"Kentucky's Underground Railroad: Passage To Freedom,"KET Education, https://www.ket.org/education/resources/kentuckys-underground-railroad-passage-freedom/ (accessed February 27, 2020).
